meanings.def: the outside or top layer of something
examples: We need a flat, smooth surface to play the game on.
an uneven road surface
a broad leaf with a large surface area
Surface water (= rainwater that has collected on the surface of a road) made driving conditions hazardous.
Teeth have a hard surface layer called enamel.
Smooth the surface with a spatula.
the inner surface of a bone
the surface layer of the skin

meanings.def: the top layer of an area of water or land
examples: the earth's surface
on the surface (of something) These plants float on the surface of the water.
below/beneath/under the surface (of something) We could see fish swimming just below the surface.
Alligators lurk beneath the surface of the swamp.
The earth’s surface temperature is rising.
Cracks began to appear in the surface of the earth.
The ball rolled onto the frozen surface of the pond.
The captain brought the submarine to the surface.
The ring slowly sank beneath the surface of the mud pool.
The wind rippled the surface of the lake.
Visible light from the sun passes through the atmosphere to the Earth's surface.

meanings.def: the flat upper part of a piece of furniture, that is used for working on
examples: She's cleaned all the kitchen surfaces.
You'll need a large smooth surface for rolling out the pastry.

meanings.def: the outer appearance of a person, thing or situation; the qualities that you see or notice, that are not hidden
examples: below/beneath/under the surface (of something) Rage bubbled just below the surface of his mind.
She gives the impression of being rather conventional, but under the surface she is wildly eccentric.

meanings.def: when not thought about deeply or carefully and completely; when not looked at carefully
examples: It seems like a good idea on the surface but there are sure to be problems.
On the surface, he appeared unchanged.
On the surface his words were funny, but I detected a lot of anger behind them.

meanings.def: to deal with, understand, or find out about only a small part of a subject or problem
examples: We left feeling that we had just scratched the surface of this fascinating country.
The investigation barely scratched the surface of the city's drug problem.

idioms.def: when not thought about deeply or carefully and completely; when not looked at carefully
examples: It seems like a good idea on the surface but there are sure to be problems.
On the surface, he appeared unchanged.
On the surface his words were funny, but I detected a lot of anger behind them.

idioms.def: to deal with, understand, or find out about only a small part of a subject or problem
examples: We left feeling that we had just scratched the surface of this fascinating country.
The investigation barely scratched the surface of the city's drug problem.

meanings.def: to come up to the surface of water
examples: The ducks dived and surfaced again several metres away.

meanings.def: to suddenly appear or become obvious after having been hidden for a while
examples: Doubts began to surface.
She surfaced again years later in London.
No further information has surfaced yet.

meanings.def: to wake up or get up after being asleep
examples: He finally surfaced around noon.

meanings.def: to put a surface on a road, path, etc.
